main event: On 13 Aug 1955, a civilian reported a sighting of a nearly round white globe or balloon with a metal frame attached, traveling from west to east close to the ground for about 1 minute, resembling the size of a B-17 aircraft.
interesting points: The unidentified object was described as blue-green in color and about the size of a B-47.
Observers estimated the location of the sighting to be 25 miles SSE of the city of Orlando, Florida.
The civilian witness reported observing the object for 5-7 minutes, providing detailed information about the weather and winds at the time.
It was initially thought to be a B-47 aircraft or a weather balloon based on various explanations.
The report suggests that the object could have been a result of sun reflections causing a halo effect around an aircraft due to the presence of heavy cumulus clouds in the area.
sighted object: nearly round white globe or balloon with a metal frame attached
location: 12 miles SE of Pinecastle AFB, Florida
